pullRequest.body:
Please carefully check the *statement* of the theorem has changed!
In particular, the file now uses the `IsSquare` predicate, which is mathematically equivalent but not defeq to the original.

---

PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [f4c3680489](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/16579/commits/f4c368048970d2acd21ec945b75a2f3eebc4346b)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

No declarations were harmed in the making of this PR! üêô
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.
Also the thing with the namespace is maybe not right how I did.

Using `IsSquare` is certainly a good idea (in general, if an IMO problem statement uses a standard mathematical definition, the formal version should use the version of that definition in mathlib, adding it there if it doesn't already exist, just as we expect reusable lemmas to be factored out into mathlib proper).

maintainer merge
üöÄ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by jsm28.

bors merge

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11263451490/job/31321349301)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/11263451490/job/31321349963)
I think you should mention in the PR what was mainly done, which is using the `IsSquare` predicate.

```suggestion
Let `n ‚â• 100` be an integer. Ivan writes the numbers `n, n + 1, ..., 2 * n` each on different cards.
```
I will change `n ‚â• 100` but I prefer to keep the rest as it was.
The general style consensus for Mathlib is to space out operators. I think our docstrings should reflect that too.
I know. I prefer not to be the one who changes this tho.

```suggestion
He then shuffles these `n + 1` cards, and divides them into two piles. Prove that at least one
```
I'd keep how it was.
This was correct. Otherwise, the main result will be named `Imo2021Q11.imo2021_q1`.
Yep, I'll revert this change.

```suggestion
theorem imo2021_q1 (n : ‚Ñï) (hn : 100 ‚â§ n) {A : Finset ‚Ñï} (hA : A ‚äÜ Finset.Icc n (2 * n)) :
```
I think this was intentional in the original version.
Hm, fair enough. I guess making the variables unnamed does make this resemble the problem statement closer.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - chore(Archive/IMO): refactoring 2021Q1
